<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 719, 920, 753]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 160]]<|/det|>
A student investigates the effect on the resistance of a wire when the tension in the wire is increased. The apparatus is shown in Fig. 4.1. The tension in the wire is increased by adding loads to the hook attached to the wire. The student measures the current \(I\) in the wire and the potential difference (p.d.) \(V\) across the wire. She determines the resistance \(R\) of the wire using the equation \(R = \frac{V}{I}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 920, 203]]<|/det|>
The student takes all the necessary safety precautions. You are **not** required to write about safety precautions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 217, 420, 234]]<|/det|>
The following apparatus is available:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 247, 322, 263]]<|/det|>
· resistance wire

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 276, 616, 293]]<|/det|>
· power source, connecting wires and crocodile clips

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 306, 272, 320]]<|/det|>
· ammeter

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 335, 275, 350]]<|/det|>
· voltmeter

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 364, 460, 380]]<|/det|>
· selection of loads and a hanger.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[133, 390, 861, 626]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[465, 640, 532, 658]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 4.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate the effect on the resistance of a wire when the tension in the wire is increased.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 119, 218, 135]]<|/det|>
